de.intarsys.security.smartcard.card.standard

Class StandardCardConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.intarsys.security.smartcard.card.CommonCardConnection
      • de.intarsys.security.smartcard.card.standard.StandardCardConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICardConnection, ICardTransmitter, de.intarsys.tools.attribute.IAttributeSupport

    public class StandardCardConnection
extends CommonCardConnection
    The abstraction of a connection opened to a StandardCard. A StandardCardConnection can be achieved by calling some of the "connect.." methods in StandardCard.

    StandardCardConnection is used in a multithreaded environment and its state is changed by either one of the multiple clients working with the StandardCard or the StandardCardTerminal controlling its state.

    StandardCard is part of the abstraction layer that is built on top of the PCSC API. From a PCSC point of view, both a PCSC context AND a PCSC connection are made for a new StandardCardConnection. This is the least common denominator for different PCSC platforms and versions. Again, this is why both the connection and the context are disposed when closing the connection.
